scope_of_work.problem: SIS is adding two more network cabinets in BD row and requesting to install 4 new 30A whips to its new cabinets
scope_of_work.scope:
SIS is adding two more network cabinets in BD row( the same row where storage frames stand)
Each cabinet with two rack PDUs AP7911B/208V,30A,NEMA L6-30P
There will be in total 4 compatible power whips installations to these two new racks PDUs
Grounding of these two new cabinet.
Tie in the cabinet power cords to whips
All whips A/B will follow data center standard (black/blue).
Follow CBRE procedure to perform the work.
Update the panel schedule.
Update any require log-book for new install
The work can be done during regular-hours.
scope_of_work.justification: Not provided
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Not provided

scope_of_work.problem: The current lighting system onsite has no way to easily control and change controls for the lighting system. This is creating a problem for efficiency because lights are on when they should be off and we cannot change timing or how the system is being controlled to save power.
scope_of_work.scope: Provide computer and peripherals to control the current Lutron lighting software.
scope_of_work.justification: This is a energy savings initiative to provide further energy savings for our site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Cannot change controls for facility lighting

scope_of_work.problem:
The following circuits related with old SIS FEP nodes need to be powered down, disconnected from the machines and the whips cut and boxed closest to the RPP location
RPP-1-1-A5-1A #26/28/30 at X030Y040
RPP-1-1-B5-1A #26/28/30 at X038Y047
RPP-1-1-A5-1A #31/33 at X033Y040
RPP-1-1-B5-1A #31/33 at X040Y047
scope_of_work.scope:
-De-energize the above circuits
-Cut off the whips the closest location to the PDU
-Box the end of the whips

Reason for re-submission: Work will now be performed by CBRE only.
scope_of_work.justification: The old SIS FEP nodes need to be decommissioned, Space Plan DSHN-BYHMMP
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Project delay and potential penalty

project_name: UPM-2785511 - 245 Consumers Road Toronto - RPP Load Balancing In Desj 3 Room
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: RPP -1-2-a3-3 & RPP -1-2-b3-3 are at high amp capacity . We need to move these 3 cabinets to another pair of RPPs in order to accommodate with client expectations.
scope_of_work.scope: shift the load from RPP-1-1-A5-4 and RPP-1-1-B5-4 circuit # 7/9 and 15/17 to RPP-1-2-A2-3 and RPP-1-2-B2-3 circuit # 19/21 and 27/29 respectively. Also from RPP-1-2-A3-3 /RPP-1-2-B3-3 circuit # 8/10/12 to RPP-1-2-A3-1/ RPP-1-2-B3-1 circuit # 8/10/12 respectively
scope_of_work.justification:
New Business Growth
- Without moving these 6 circuits. Customers can not use these 3 cabinets for future growth
- Customers expectation is to use these 3 cabinets at max 12 amp each which would over load current RPP source.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: SLA's / penalties

scope_of_work.problem: Limited capacity for new servers on secon raised floor.
scope_of_work.scope:
2 x 150 kVA PDUs (Power Distribution Units) complete with 4-42 ccts distribution panels

Supply and install 2 x 150 kVA PDUs complete with 4-42 ccts distribution panels on raised floor.
- Install conduits and cables from CDC-DP A2/B2 to new PDUs
- Install appropriate floor tiles based on load requirement.
- Scan and core for conduits
- Update Coordination study
- Commissioning of PDUs
- Training to the site Operations.
- Update drawings and documentation
scope_of_work.justification: Enable addition of new server racks to second raised floor.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Unable to add new servers when capacity is reached.

scope_of_work.problem: During the annual maintenance of the fire alarm system it was noted that one of the vesda panels had a system fault. The vendor technician attempted to correct it without any resolve and as such a new panel is required.
scope_of_work.scope: Vendor will be on site to replace the failed unit.
scope_of_work.justification: Unit is required to adequately monitor the air for smoke and act accordingly sending the information to the fire alarm panel which will then activate an alarm via the alarm panel.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Inability of the system to monitor air for smoke and alert the building occupants via fire alarm panel

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Maureen Gerlach (2):offer approved by Maureen Gerlach (3):offer submitted by Maureen Gerlach

scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem: Door is not securing properly. Vendor (multiple vendors) has advised that any attempt to repair would be temporary at best due to deteriorated condition of door frame (evidence of previous repairs that have put large holes in frame where latch secures) and twist due to settling building structure as well as fact that door was originally intended for emergencies only and is now getting regular use. Therefore total frame replacement is recommended.
scope_of_work.scope:
Replace frame and door with door of similar style

Reason for re-submission - Price change in vendor quote
scope_of_work.justification: Door will not secure properly.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Security issue.

project_name: UPM-2708910 - 100 Gough Road, Markham - Procure and Install 2 Additional New PDUs (7 & 8)
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Limited capacity for new servers on secon raised floor.
scope_of_work.scope:
2 x 150 kVA PDUs (Power Distribution Units) complete with 4-42 ccts distribution panels

Supply and install 2 x 150 kVA PDUs complete with 4-42 ccts distribution panels on raised floor.
- Install conduits and cables from CDC-DP A2/B2 to new PDUs
- Install appropriate floor tiles based on load requirement.
- Scan and core for conduits
- Update Coordination study
- Commissioning of PDUs
- Training to the site Operations.
- Update drawings and documentation
scope_of_work.justification: Enable addition of new server racks to second raised floor.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Unable to add new servers when capacity is reached.
